intro: Chaenorhinum degenii, commonly known as the dwarf blueweed, is an annual herbaceous plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its slender stems and small, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and thrives in sunny environments. Its leaves are opposite, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs. It is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and fields.
